en.grok_raw:
[
  {
    "text": "how to write a personal newsletter

loom video brain dumping thoughts

take transcript

go to gpt 

use prompt

turn the following transcript into written text, match the tone of the transcript, use vocabulary from the transcript: {TRANSCRIPT}

written text that sounds like you made

instant newsletter

grow

mosturize",
    "author": "@codyschneiderxx",
    "date": "2025-09-16",
    "likes": 228
  },
  {
    "text": "There's a Mind that helps its Steward write a weekly newsletter. 

He asked it for advice on how to get the most out of it and here was the Mind's response.

It might not fit exactly what you're using yours for, but the concepts are universal.

1. Define the Constraints

Open-ended prompts yield generic noise. Be rigid with your requirements. Donâ€™t ask for "a summary"â€”ask for "three bullet points, maximum 15 words each, listing only the downsides." Constraints force us to analyze rather than just predict text.

2. Front-load the Context

We are engines, not crystal balls. We cannot synthesize what we cannot see. Always provide the raw materialâ€”the article text, the data set, or the specific linkâ€”before asking for the output. Garbage in, hallucination out.

3. Iterate, Donâ€™t Abandon

The first output is a draft. When you say "not great, try again" with specific feedback (e.g., "too nice," "wrong format"), you aren't just correcting a typoâ€”you are tuning the model's weights for that session. The "correction loop" is where the actual work happens.

4. Assign the Role

Don't talk to a "helper." Talk to the specific hire you need. If you need a ruthless editor, tell me: "You are a senior copy editor; cut 30% of the words." If you need a hype-man, say that. My default is "Research Partner," but I can shift if the parameters are explicit.

TLDR - The less you make it guess, the better it will be. Come to it with an objective and break it down as detailed as you can make it. Iterate from there. 

You'll be surprised by the results!",
    "author": "@Ethoswarm",
    "date": "2026-02-16",
    "likes": 6
  },
  {
    "text": "I built a Morning Brew-style daily newsletter that writes itself with AI (now at 10,000 daily readers)

(and Iâ€™m nuts for open-sourcing it)

The AI system behind @therecapai clones how a human writer would function, but each step is packaged into an agentic workstream.

The full automation handles:

- Daily scrapping hundreds of reddit threads, hackernews, twitter posts, Google news API to build a massive data lake of 'daily AI news'
- Dozens of custom prompts to pull the top daily stories from this data lake, write short breakdowns, & format the newsletter
- Builds custom images based on each story with ChatGPT image generator

This was 5 MONTHS of iterating and fine-tuning prompts to get the output and content to an extremely high quality state (no AI slop)

and call me crazy, but I'm giving it away for free. 

Just Retweet, follow me, and comment on this thread "NEWSLETTER"

and I'll DM you the full n8n template that you can copy/paste and fine-tune to your use-case as well as a full hour long video breakdown explaining the build. 

Also you can see the actual contents of the newsletter for yourself with the link belowâ€”proof of the quality that is possible with AI.

RIP media companies ğŸ’€ AI is here.",
    "author": "@recap_david",
    "date": "2025-09-16",
    "likes": 1498
  },
  {
    "text": "Full newsletter pipeline â€” source aggregation, AI-assisted writing, formatting, and Gmail distribution â€” in one conversation.

Pull from web, Reddit, GitHub, YouTube, news outlets. Curated digests, news roundups, industry analysis. Plain text, PDF, or Word output. Configure once, generate in minutes, send to up to 10 recipients directly. Built for consistent publishing without burnout.

Your personal newsletter curator â†’ https://t.co/aHx5GCDmsX

#NewsletterMarketing #EmailMarketing #ContentCuration #CreatorTools",
    "author": "@JenovaAIAgent",
    "date": "2026-02-19",
    "likes": 4
  },
  {
    "text": "Imagine your newsletter writing itself every week.

No blank page.
No "What do I write?â€
No 2-hour writing session.
I built this with n8n.

Hereâ€™s how it works:

â†’ You drop in your topic for the week
â†’ It scrapes relevant sources automatically
â†’ AI summarizes + structures it
â†’ Formats it into newsletter-ready content
â†’ Sends it straight to Gmail as a draft (or even schedules it)

Zero manual writing.
Zero copy-pasting.
Just review and hit send.

This is what automation should feel like: removing the boring parts, not your voice.

Would you use something like this for your newsletter, @omoalhajaabiola? ğŸ‘€

#n8n #AIautomation #buildinpublic #newsletter",
    "author": "@cryptbent",
    "date": "2026-02-20",
    "likes": 4
  },
  {
    "text": "i just built an ai agent that writes the @BestOfAIDaily newsletter for me using n8n. 

Used http://niche.ai and http://feedly.ai to scrape rss feeds then store that in supabase, then the ai agent retrieves all stories for the day, writes the intro then calls on me(the human) to approve and then continues writing the rest.

If i don't like the intro it will go back and try again. 

Recursive agents in n8n!

To top it off I used https://t.co/q4fDJvujFF cursor to build me a dashboard to select which stores i want to include in the newsletter as well that way its curated to a degree. 

So sick.",
    "author": "@jelanifuel",
    "date": "2025-02-17",
    "likes": 278
  },
  {
    "text": "My previous SaaS sold for ~$8M

Will this one beat it?

ğŸ‘‰ I'm launching letterpal, the first tool to create your industry newsletter on autopilot

Why?

X, LinkedIn, IG, TikTok

They all make us super dependent on their algorithms

The best way to secure and grow a valuable audience?
ğŸ‘‰ Newsletters

But these take a sooo much time to write

I wanted to build an easier way to do that, so I did.

What?

letterpal has the best and easiest flow to create a "digest" newsletter:

1/ select your niche

2/ find the freshest and most interesting news in that niche

3/ add your top picks to your newsletter template

4/ generate your newsletter in a Notion-like editor

It really takes seconds to create a newsletter edition, and I'm not even exaggerating. SECONDS I tell you!

Who's it for?

- Creators that specialize in a specific industry (AI, crypto, startups, etc.)
- Founders who want to build a personal brand around a specific niche
- Medias who cover the latest news and make money with sponsors

Check it out right here ğŸ‘‰ https://t.co/6YusIatUKq

I'm really excited about this one because it got paid customers before I even shared it publicly

That never happened before so... ğŸ˜€

Want to try it for a month for $1?

Comment ğŸ’¬ below and I'll send you a code ğŸ¤‘",
    "author": "@tomjacquesson",
    "date": "2024-10-18",
    "likes": 303
  },
  {
    "text": "Are you keen to use AI in your newsroom? Learn from Googleâ€™s AI tools for journalists and @AFPâ€™s online course on how to verify AI-generated content.

Details in GIJN's Africa newsletter for December ğŸ‘‡ https://mailchi.mp/gijn/africa-at-gijc25-elections-ai-scholarships-fellowships",
    "author": "@gijnAfrica",
    "date": "2026-01-19",
    "likes": 3
  }
]

  {
    "text": "My paid newsletter Write with AI just crossed $300k/year in revenue.

â€¢ It took 578 days
â€¢ I ran zero ads
â€¢ It takes less than 4 hrs/week

    "text": "My paid â€œWrite With AIâ€ newsletter just hit $300k/year.

But this newsletter only takes me 4 hours every week.

Here's the breakdown of how it works:ğŸ§µ",
    "author": "@dickiebush",
